content: ` kitty b scarf by amy odin i designed this simple sweet scarf to introduce knitters to the joys of working lace but seasoned knitters will find it to be a relaxing project with beautiful results the slipped stitch selvedge edge and garter ridge scalloped ends give it the perfect finishing touches with just a two-row repeat it works up with ease _____________________________________________ finished measurements 6 x 76 inches materials 300 yards fingering weight yarn shown in madelinetosh tosh sock colorway 203 1 skein 100 % merino wool us 6 needles gauge 24 sts and 25 rnds = 4 inches in lace pattern after blocking special abbreviations yo yarn over bring yarn to the front in-between the two needles then wrap it around your right needle and work the next stitch as usual k2tog - knit 2 stitches together sl1 wyif slip 1 with yarn in front bring yarn to the front of your work then slip the next stitch purlwise ssk slip slip knit slip 2 stitches knitwise one at a time insert l needle into the front of those stitches and knit them together s2tog -k1-p2sso - slip 2 stitches knitwise at the same time then knit the next stitch using the left needle pass those 2 slipped stitches over the one just worked notes to work the decreases more easily use needles with sharp tips let s be practical about that gauge swatch if you prefer the possibility of saving time begin the scarf by knitting the garter end and about 5 inches of lace measure then steam or spray block while your work is still on the needles and measure again that way if you re spot on you can carry on © 2021 amy odin designer can be contacted at amy c odin@gmail com refer to before and after gauge measurements to determine how much your lace fabric will grow after blocking from these you can do the math and know where to end your scarf unblocked lace fabric typically measures significantly smaller than its final dimensions to work a wider scarf cast on additional stitches in groups of 10 work instructions between parentheses on row 4 one extra time for each additional set of 10 begin co 37 stitches using the long tail cast on method row 1-3 knit to the last stitch sl1 wyif row 4 rs k3 ssk k3 yo k1 yo k3 sl2tog-k1-p2sso 2 times k3 yo k1 yo k3 k2tog k2 sl1 wyif row 5 ws k3 purl to last 3 stitches k2 sl1 wyif repeat row 4 and 5 until desired length see notes section regarding determining length knit row 4 once more repeat row 1-3 bind off loosely in knit blocking soak in cool water with a little wool wash for at least 20 minutes gently roll in a towel and press until damp using blocking wires weave in evenly on the long sides just inside the selvedge stitch edge and pin to desired width pin out the
